question: Match the following oviduct and uterus terms with their NCERT-based descriptions:
column_II: Funnel-shaped part of oviduct closer to the ovary
Finger-like projections which help in collection of the ovum
matches: Oviducts (fallopian tubes), uterus and vagina–Female accessory ducts
Each fallopian tube length–About 10-12 cm long
Infundibulum–Funnel-shaped part of oviduct closer to the ovary
Fimbriae–Finger-like projections which help in collection of the ovum

question: Match the following ampulla, isthmus and uterus terms with NCERT-based descriptions:
column_II: Last part of oviduct with narrow lumen
matches: Isthmus–Last part of oviduct with narrow lumen
Shape of uterus–Like an inverted pear

question: Match the following cervix, canal and uterine layers with NCERT-based descriptions:
column_II: Narrow opening of uterus into vagina
External thin membranous layer of uterus
Middle thick layer of smooth muscle in uterus
matches: Cervix–Narrow opening of uterus into vagina
Cervical canal and vagina–Forms the birth canal
Perimetrium–External thin membranous layer of uterus
Myometrium–Middle thick layer of smooth muscle in uterus

question: Match the following endometrium and uterine function terms with NCERT-based descriptions:
column_II: Undergoes cyclical changes during menstrual cycle
Exhibits strong contraction during delivery of the baby
Supported by ligaments attached to the pelvic wall
matches: Function of endometrium–Undergoes cyclical changes during menstrual cycle
Function of myometrium–Exhibits strong contraction during delivery of the baby
Support of uterus–Supported by ligaments attached to the pelvic wall
